intro: Neillia uekii var. typica, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are fibrous and have been historically used for making baskets and other woven goods. Neillia uekii var. typica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
